dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Angelica{/it}) of herbs of the carrot family
{bc}a Eurasian biennial or perennial ({it}A. archangelica{/it}) whose roots and seeds yield a flavoring oil and whose young stems are often candied

et: New Latin, genus name, from Medieval Latin, from Late Latin, feminine of {it}angelicus{/it} angelic, from Late Greek {it}angelikos{/it}, from Greek, of a messenger, from {it}angelos{/it}
shortdef: any of a genus (Angelica) of herbs of the carrot family; especially : a Eurasian biennial or perennial (A. archangelica) whose roots and seeds yield a flavoring oil and whose young stems are often candied

dt: {bc}a small prickly eastern U.S. tree ({it}Aralia spinosa{/it}) of the ginseng family with large compound leaves
{bc}a small prickly southern U.S. tree ({it}Zanthoxylum clava-herculis{/it}) of the rue family

shortdef: a small prickly eastern U.S. tree (Aralia spinosa) of the ginseng family with large compound leaves —called also angelica tree
a small prickly southern U.S. tree (Zanthoxylum clava-herculis) of the rue family
